intro: Pavetta lateriflora, commonly known as the side-flowered pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its inflorescence is unique, with flowers arranged laterally along the stems, giving it its common name. Pavetta lateriflora is also noted for its medicinal properties, used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
